info.title: Handwrytten API
info.description:
This is the Handwrytten API for sending cards written in the handwriting of your choice.
Using this api, you can send cards to users.  You can also customize cards with logos, which
can be saved and then used like any other card in the system.
For a "sandbox" account, please contact contact@handwrytten.com
To move from credit card per-transaction to monthly invoicing, also contact us.
[https://www.handwrytten.com](https://www.handwrytten.com)

tags.name: auth
tags.description: Commands for creating and registering accounts and logging in/out

tags.name: cards
tags.description: access information on cards and card categories

tags.name: templates
tags.description: access information on saved message templates

externalDocs.description: Find out more about our service

post.summary: Logs in to an existing account

free_cards.description: number of free cards in account

uid.description: token for future authorized calls
the authorized UID of the session
the authorized UID of the session

login.description: the email address of the user

card_id.description: the card id of the card template you're starting with.  You can find this by logging into Handwrytten, clicking "customize" next to any customizable card, and pulling the card ID from the end of the URL

cover_id.description: the id of the image you want to use for the "cover".  The cover is the large image on the front of the flat card.

cover_size_percent.description: the size of the image to use as the cover.

footer_align.description: set to "left", "center", or "right" to align the footer appropriately

footer_font_id.description: font ID of the text in the footer, found by using ListFontForCustomizer

footer_font_size.description: Font size of the text in the footer

footer_text.description: optional text for the footer of the customizable card

header_align.description: set to "left", "center", or "right" to align the header appropriately

header_auto_size.description: if set to true, the header will be maximized to fill the header area

header_font_id.description: font ID of the text in the header, found by using ListFontForCustomizer

header_font_size.description: font size of the text in the header of the card

header_text.description: text in the header, if type is set to "text"

logo_id.description: Optional.  If setting "type" to "logo", set the id of the logo here.

logo_size_percent.description: set to the desired scaling of the logo on the header

name.description: the name of the new card

type.description: Defines the top of the back of the card. Set to either "logo" or "text".

uid.description: authorized UID of the session.

get.description: Filterable card list.  If called with UID will also provide user-specific cards.

post.description: Simple listing of cards.  No filters can be applied.

uid.description: optional authorized UID of the session.  By providing this, the card list will include user-specific cards.

post.summary: upload logo or cover image for card

uid.description: uid of the user

post.summary: Provides full information on a specific card

uid.description: optional authorized UID of the session.  By providing this, the card details can provide user-specific cards

get.description: Lists the countries to which Handwritten can mail, their associated country ID and any costs

get.summary: Lists Handwryting styles available for use
Lists fonts available for use with the card customizer

get.description: Returns images and details (and associated denominations) of all gift cards

post.description: Returns images and details (and associated denominations) of all gift cards

post.summary: sends an order in a single step.  This is much easier than using other order commands
post.description: Sends an order in one step.  No need to create then process order.  Optionally include a gift card.

card_id.description: the id of the card you want to send

credit_card_id.description: the credit card id to charge for the order.  Currently this is required, even for invoiced accounts, it just won't be charged.

denomination_id.description: Optional.  Use if sending a gift card

font_label.description: the colloquial name of the font, such as 'Fancy Jenna' or 'Casual David'

message.description: the full message body.  Use '\n' for new lines
message.example:
Dear Frank,
Thank you so much for your interest in our services.
Yours,
Joe

recipient_address1.description: the first address line of the return address

recipient_address2.description: the second line of the address, such as suite, apartment, building, etc. Optional

recipient_business_name.description: the second line of the recipient address.  Optional.

recipient_city.description: the city of the recipient, to appear in the address

recipient_country.description: the country of the recipient.  Optional and defaults to usa

recipient_country_id.description: alternate way to specify country.  Optional and defaults to 1

recipient_name.description: the name on the recipient address

recipient_state.description: the ABBREVIATED state or province of the recipient.  This is required for US and Canada addresses and optional for all other countries

recipient_zip.description: the zip code or postal code of the recipient

sender_address1.description: the first address line of the return address

sender_address2.description: the second line of the address, such as suite, apartment, building, etc. Optional

sender_business_name.description: the second line of the return address.  Optional.

sender_city.description: the city of the sender, to appear in the return address

sender_country.description: the country of the recipient.  Optional and defaults to usa

sender_country_id.description: alternate way to specify country.  Optional and defaults to 1

sender_name.description: the name on the return address

sender_state.description: the ABBREVIATED state or province of the sender.  This is required for US and Canada addresses and optional for all other countries

sender_zip.description: The postal code or zip code of the sender.

uid.description: The UID of the logged-in user

post.summary: gets the user's return address information

uid.description: authorized UID of the session.  By providing this, the card list will include user-specific cards.

address_id.description: the id of the address to delete

uid.description: authorized UID of the session.

address1.description: the first line of the address

address2.description: the second (optional) line of the address

business_name.description: the optional business name on the address

country.description: the name of the country of the address, or use country_id

country_id.description: the country id code of the recipient

state.description: the abbreviated state or province of the address

uid.description: authorized UID of the session.

zip.description: the zip or postal code of the address

post.summary: list the addresses in the user's account

uid.description: authorized UID of the session.

post.summary: update the user's return address information

address1.description: the first line of the address

address2.description: the second (optional) line of the address

business_name.description: the optional business name on the address

country.description: the name of the country of the address

country_id.description: the id of the country of the address. do not use with "country" parameter

state.description: the abbreviated state or province of the address

uid.description: authorized UID of the session.

zip.description: the zip or postal code of the address

post.summary: updates an existing new recipient address

address1.description: the updated first line of the address

address2.description: the updated second (optional) line of the address

business_name.description: the updated optional business name on the address

city.description: the updated city of the address

country.description: the updated name of the country of the address, or use country_id

country_id.description: the country id of the address

id.description: the id of the address to update

name.description: the updated name on the address

state.description: the updated abbreviated state or province of the address

uid.description: authorized UID of the session.

zip.description: the updated zip or postal code of the address

get.description: Lists the common template categories of all users. As you are not logged in, this is what you are limited to.

post.description: Lists the template categories of all users. By passing the optional UID, any custom template categories are also available.

uid.description: optional authorized UID of the session.  By providing this, the template list will include user-specific template categories

post.summary: Creates a New Template in the User’s Account
post.description: Creates a new Template in the User’s Account

message.example: How do I love thee?  Let me count the ways

name.description: the new name of the template

uid.description: The UID of the logged-in user

post.description: Deletes a template in the User’s Account

template_id.description: the ID of the template to delete

uid.description: The UID of the logged-in user

get.description: Lists the common template categories of all users. As you are not logged in, this is what you are limited to.

category_id.description: optional category to filter the templates

uid.description: optional authorized UID of the session.  By providing this, the template list will include user-specific template categories

address1.description: the first line of the address

state.description: the abbreviated state or province of the address

zip.description: the zip or postal code of the address

cover_height.description: the height in px of the cover image

cover_width.description: the width in px of the cover image

price.description: the base price of a card (in USD)

available_free.description: 1 for cards that are available free

states.description: Optional states or provinces in country

id.description: the unique ID of the order
